Food Sociology

This course is designed to provide students with a theoretical base for the understanding of sociology principles and their implication on the field of food studies. The module exposes students to the concept of model and socialization, and how they shape human eating habits and the setting of food culture. Students are exposed to concrete application of food sociology finding on food service concepts or products

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Explain key sociological concept and the purpose of the discipline.

+  Explain key concepts and frameworks used in food Studies.

+  Understand the evolution of food model and eating habits and the major changes of human food system.

+  To explain limits of human towards food acceptance and the influence of socialization on the omnivore paradox.

+  To explain the key social factors behind the rise of obesity worldwide.
